alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 1:59PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS THIS AFTERNOON... There has been an isolated report or two of an instantaneous gust of 40 to 45 mph, its momentum perhaps assisted by a band of showers that has developed along a frontal boundary. But mostly, peak gusts are in the low to mid 30s mph. Broadly, 20 to 30 mph is most commonplace. Gusts this high will produce a hazard for area drivers, especially high profile type vehicles and tractor trailers. High wave conditions will plague area lakes. Secure any loose items you don`t want blown around as well. If a higher gust occurs, it`s possible a poorly, shallow, or wet rooted tree can be downed. Limbs might blow down, and it`s not unheard of to have a power outage as a result of winds gusting like they will this afternoon. Take the necessary precautions and remain weather aware.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
